;A few days ago, a social media blogger released a video expressing doubts about whether the 12 songs from the "Mayday" Shanghai concert are true. Sing expressed doubts, and the information quickly rose to the top of a social media trending list. "Mayday" has not yet responded to this matter.

Prevent the occurrence of lip-syncing behavior."

;In 45 years, China has transformed from a small financial country to a large financial country.

;

;Many financial indicators are among the best in the world. What is particularly commendable is that the stock of green loans ranks first in the world, and digital financial innovation has always been at the forefront of international peers. At the same time, both the bond market balance and wealth management scale rank second in the world.

;

;However, there is no denying the current situation that finance is big but not strong. On its new journey from a financial power to a financial power, what leading indicators can China achieve to become a financial power? At the same time, risks always accompany the development of the financial industry. In the new process of deepening reform and further high-level opening up, how to resist the transmission of international financial risks? How to resolve local risks and avoid internal systemic risks? How can financial supervision improve efficiency in the digital era?

;

;To this end, Southern Weekend conducted an exclusive interview with Zhang Chenghui, former director of the Financial Research Institute of the Development Research Center of the State Council. She is currently the executive director of the China Society of Modern Finance and a member of the Strategic Advisory Committee of Tsinghua University PBC School of Finance. Zhang Chenghui has been engaged in financial research for 30 years. He has participated in more than 30 major and key projects of the Development Research Center of the State Council, including the "Overall Concept of Financial System Reform", and presided over dozens of projects such as "Research on the Supervision, Control and Management of China's Money Market". , won many awards such as China Development Award.

;

;In an exclusive interview with Southern Weekend, she said that building a financial power must meet at least five conditions, such as: financial institutions must be internationally competitive, the RMB must become a mainstream international currency, and China's financial market must be in the international financial market. They must have a say in formulating rules. She also hopes that, with the rapid development of digitalization, technology should be better used to improve regulatory efficiency after the regulatory system is established, the regulatory framework and regulatory policies are clear. The use of modern regulatory technology can, to a certain extent, avoid the situation of "if you let it go, it will lead to chaos, but if you put it under control, it will die", and better improve the efficiency of financial institutions in serving the real economy.

;

;;

;

;State Council Development Research Zhang Chenghui, former director of the Central Institute of Finance, executive director of the Modern Finance Society of China, and member of the Strategic Advisory Committee of Tsinghua University PBC School of Finance. (Photo provided by interviewee)

;

;Rectifying the financial order has laid a solid foundation for financial stability

;

;;Southern Weekend:;< span style="font-family: KaiTi, KaiTi_GB2312, SimKai, STKaiti;">;;;;You have been engaged in financial research at the Development Research Center of the State Council for many years. This period was a critical period for China to promote the reform and opening up of the financial industry. What's the thing that impressed you most? ;;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:;;I was transferred to the Development Research Center of the State Council in 1993. I initially studied finance in the Macroeconomic Department because there was no Established a financial research institute. Since 2003, I have served as deputy director and director of the Institute of Finance. So far, I have been engaged in research work on financial reform for thirty years. What impressed me most during this period was attending the first national financial work conference in 1997 and listening to the passionate unscripted speech of the then State Council leader.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why this meeting deep impression? ;;;;;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:; strong>;;The general background of this meeting is that after China's reform entered the fast lane in the 1980s, the original administrative controls were relaxed, but the regulatory logic and regulatory structure in line with market rules have not yet been established, which has led to financial disorder and financial risks. The three typical problems at that time were random fund-raising, random financial institutions and financial business. In terms of market access management for financial institutions and quasi-financial institutions, various financial markets such as bill markets, regional over-the-counter securities markets, and futures markets have flourished everywhere. ;

;

;Around the core of controlling financial chaos, this meeting introduced a series of measures, focusing on rectifying and standardizing financial order, preventing and resolving financial risks. For example: the People's Bank of China reformed its own institutions; approved the establishment of the Central Financial Working Committee; canceled the control of loan limits of state-owned commercial banks; issued special treasury bonds in a targeted manner to replenish the capital of state-owned commercial banks by 270 billion yuan; replenished the capital of commercial banks; established The four major asset management companies, etc.

;

;;;;The series of decisions made at this meeting are of far-reaching significance. For example, the approval of the establishment of the Financial Working Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China not only shows the importance of financial work, but also strengthens the party's leadership over financial institutions. This is a big reform; the central bank's restrictions on the loan quota of commercial banks are cancelled, and the restrictions on commercial banks' loan quotas are replaced. Banks implement asset-liability ratio and risk management, and the regulatory model is closer to the direction of market economy development; capital replenishment of state-owned banks and the establishment of four major asset management companies have laid the foundation for solving the problem of deterioration of the balance sheets of the four major state-owned banks. . ;

;

;It now appears that these measures laid a solid foundation for domestic financial stability at that time. During the outbreak of the Asian financial crisis in 1997, some Southeast Asian countries suffered heavy losses, but the domestic financial market was not directly affected, and the finance and economy continued to remain stable.

;

;Reports are often years ahead of reality because they are forward-looking

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;China has been promoting financial reform and opening up. Financial reform has also been one of your main research directions. Among the major key projects that you have participated in or chaired by the Development Research Center of the State Council, which research reports have given you a particularly sense of accomplishment? Why? ;;;;;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:; strong>;;The State Council’s positioning of the Development Research Center is “four characteristics”, namely forward-looking, strategic, overall, and comprehensive. Therefore, one of the characteristics of our reports is that they are forward-looking. ;

;

;Among our many reports on financial risk prevention, capital market reform, small and medium-sized enterprise financing and green finance, the most fulfilling one was completed with my colleagues during the 1997 Asian financial crisis. Asian Financial Trends Tracking Report. At that time, the Development Research Center of the State Council selected eight Ph.D.s to set up an Asian financial trend tracking group, and I was one of the members. As an advantage, the Information Center of the Development Research Center of the State Council began to establish an information system in the 1990s. This is the first among government departments, allowing us to track overseas financial trends in real time.

;

;We work overtime every day, producing one report or even two or three reports in one or two days on average, reflecting international financial trends in a timely manner and putting forward response suggestions. These reports were promptly delivered to the prime minister or deputy prime minister in charge. These reports were later compiled into two books. This was the first time since my country's reform and opening up that China had to deal with a financial crisis originating overseas. Some of our suggestions played a good role at that time.

;

;The second thing that gives me a sense of accomplishment is that I organized and wrote several reports on the full circulation of China's stock market in 2002, and conducted an in-depth analysis of the congenital institutional defects of the capital market, namely split shares. Call for the advancement of equity split reform in the capital market. It was in 2005 that the State Council made the determination to promote the share-trading reform. The third is that based on the examination of international experience and in-depth research on the domestic financing guarantee industry, it was found that my country's commercial financing guarantee system is not sustainable, and it is recommended to establish a policy financing guarantee fund at the national level. This suggestion was later adopted and implemented.

;

;Because we are forward-looking and because reform decisions require careful design, our recommendations often precede the implementation of policies by several years. In addition, I write a lot of reports, so I don’t pay much attention to the implementation of each report. ;Financial risk prevention needs to be considered in a specific context;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In addition to the major reform and opening up In addition to this topic, you have also participated in or chaired research on many major topics on financial risk prevention. Why is there so much focus on this aspect? ;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:;;This is very important to China. If financial risks cannot be controlled, all opening up and deepening reforms will be empty talk. Once financial risks detonate and systemic financial risks occur, it is a financial crisis, which will have a huge impact on a country's wealth, economy, financial order and financial markets. Risk prevention is the first concern of all regulatory authorities in the world. ;

;

;Of course, there are some dialectical relationships that need to be handled here. For example, how to properly handle the relationship between financial openness and financial risks, and how to properly handle the relationship between economic development and financial risk prevention and control. In different periods, the forms and degrees of risk are different, and the strategies and measures to deal with risks are also different. Therefore, attention to this area is a dynamic and dialectical work that needs to be considered within a specific historical context.

;

;Since the first National Financial Work Conference, every government has paid great attention to the issue of financial risks and invested a lot of energy and resources in preventing and resolving financial risks. As a national think tank, the issues that the leaders of the State Council are concerned about are the focus of our research. Therefore, the prevention and resolution of financial risks has always been one of the important contents of our research.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;In the 45 years of reform and opening up of the financial industry, our country has been affected by international economic crises or financial crises many times. , but there is no internal systemic financial risk. What do you think is the main reason? ;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:;;Over the past forty years, there have definitely been local or certain industry risks. Being able to deal with local risks in a timely manner will have a positive impact on the entire industry. There has been no major impact on the financial system, which is an important achievement of China's financial supervision. ;

;

;There are two main reasons: First, my country has controlled the pace of opening up the financial market and opened up to the outside world in a more prudent and steady manner. When the country does not have regulatory capabilities and financial institutions are not competitive, hastily opening the market will only bring many opportunities for international financial predators and put great pressure on domestic financial stability. This is the case in some Southeast Asian countries. National history lessons. In contrast, my country's opening up to the outside world is prudent and steady.

;

;Second, after the risks are discovered, the central government’s macro-control is relatively powerful and can deal with and resolve the risks in a timely and effective manner. Taking the four major state-owned commercial banks as an example, after undergoing three major steps: financial restructuring, corporate governance reform and capital market listing, state-owned banks have successfully resolved financial risks and ushered in a new stage of reform and development.

;

;Better use of financial technology and regulatory technology

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The Central Financial Work Conference proposed, There are still many hidden economic and financial risks, and we must persist in preventing and defusing risks. In addition to strengthening supervision, what do you think can be done more effectively? ;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:;;First of all, it must be clear that as long as you engage in finance, there will always be risks. Because the essence of finance is to allocate financial assets across regions, time, and markets. In this process, risks such as maturity mismatch and risk-return mismatch will definitely arise. The key is how to manage financial risks. Secondly, financial supervision is to prevent individual, small-scale financial risks from spreading and developing into regional risks. Sometimes regional risks are unavoidable, so it is necessary to prevent them from becoming systemic risks. ;

;

;Looking at the financial history of various countries around the world, there was no financial supervision at the beginning. It is precisely because of the risks that it has had a great impact on the economy and finance. Slowly, countries have begun to establish and improve financial supervision systems. What financial supervision needs to solve is how to better handle the relationship between efficiency and risk so that finance can better serve the real economy. We can neither control financial institutions in order to control risks, nor allow them to engage in various self-liberating financial innovations.

;

;Of course, the construction of a regulatory system is very important. Today, with the rapid development of digitalization, after the regulatory system is established, the regulatory framework and regulatory policies are clarified, technology should be better used to improve regulatory efficiency. The use of modern regulatory technology can, to a certain extent, avoid the situation of "if you let it go, it will lead to chaos, but if you put it under control, it will die", and better improve the efficiency of financial institutions in serving the real economy.

;

;A few years ago, the Financial Regulatory Authority of Singapore established a chief technology officer. The latest establishment of my country’s State Administration of Financial Supervision includes a chief risk officer, chief prosecutor and chief lawyer, but does not have a chief technology officer. I feel a little regretful.

;

;Have a say in the formulation of international financial rules

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Since the reform and opening up, China has grown from a small financial country to a big financial country, and many of its financial indicators are among the best in the world. Which financial indicators do you think deserve special attention? ;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:;;After more than 40 years of reform, opening up and financial development, my country has transformed from a weak and small country to a big financial country. The scale of our financial market, the size of financial institutions and the number of financial assets rank among the top in the world. This is something to be proud of. ;

;

;For example, China is now the world’s largest deposit market and loan market, the world’s largest commercial banking system, the world’s second largest insurance market, the world’s second largest bond market, and the world’s second largest Wealth management market. The 2023 Top 1000 World Banks released by the British "Banker" magazine shows that ICBC, China Construction Bank, Agricultural Bank of China and Bank of China have ranked among the top four for the sixth consecutive year. Overall, China holds 32.67% of the world's first-tier capital and 27.69% of its assets. China's finance has become an important force that cannot be ignored in the international financial market. In addition, China’s financial technology is also far ahead of other countries.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The Central Financial Work Conference proposed for the first time that we should speed up the construction of a financial power. What is the most fundamental difference between a financial power and a financial power? ;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui: ;;A few years ago, I did relevant research. ;

;

;I believe that a financial power must meet at least the following five points:

;

;First, financial institutions must be internationally competitive. At present, most of the business of major domestic financial institutions is concentrated in the domestic market. The business volume in the international market is not large, and the competitiveness of profitability is relatively insufficient. For example, in the field of wealth management, domestic asset management institutions have basically no reputation among their international peers.

;

;Second, the RMB must become a mainstream international currency and be more widely accepted by the international financial market. Data released by the Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication show that in September 2023, in the ranking of global payment currencies based on amount statistics, the RMB accounted for 3.71%. Although this proportion has set a new historical record, it is 40% more than the US dollar and 20% more than the euro. There is still a big gap in the proportion of %.

;

;Third, China’s financial market is influential in the international financial market. At present, the domestic commodity market and gold market have begun to have some influence in the international market, but there are still quite a few commodities that lack pricing power in the international market.

;

;Fourth, on the premise of effectively controlling risks, it can attract international capital to enter our country's capital market and capital market, serve the real economy and promote financial development.

;

;Fifth, we must have a say in formulating rules for international financial markets. For example, financial regulatory rules, ESG standards, etc. To achieve this goal, you must first do your own things well. Only by doing better than others can you have a say.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The Central Financial Work Conference proposed that “efforts should be made to promote high-level financial opening up” ” and “steadily expand institutional opening up in the financial sector.” What do you think are the differences between "high-level openness" and "institutional openness" compared to the past? ;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:; "High-level opening up" focuses on the market access level, opening up to foreign financial institutions including capital markets, capital markets, insurance markets, etc. Factor markets have lower entry thresholds and fewer constraints than before; institutional opening up must be based on international economic and trade rules and international financial market rules to form some institutional environments that are conducive to China's opening up to the outside world, especially high-level opening up to the outside world, and improve China’s institutional supply capacity. At the same time, the role of rule-maker is transformed from participant to rule-maker.

;

;From a dialectical relationship, "high-level opening to the outside world" is the premise of "institutional opening to the outside world", and institutional opening to the outside world is the guarantee of "high-level opening to the outside world". Compared with the opening of commodity and factor markets, institutional opening is a higher level of opening and is an inevitable choice to achieve high-level opening to the outside world. Through institutional opening, we can further deepen the connotation of high-level opening up and improve the quality of opening up.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;If China wants to transform from a financial power to a financial power, what do you think it should do? ;

;

;;Zhang Chenghui:;;How to build a financial power is a big topic. I can't answer in a few sentences. To summarize at a high level, in one sentence, we must further deepen reform and opening up in the financial sector. ;

;

;;(Chen Meixi also contributed to this article.);

;Yang Baozhang (1925-2023), Henan cross talk actor;;

;

;The life of cross talk master Yang Baozhang is very similar to the script of traditional opera: he comes from a poor family and does not study hard. He often goes to Kaifeng Xiangguo Temple not far from his home to listen to cross talk, and he becomes famous. Fascinated, he finally gave up on literature and art and became a crosstalk actor. At that time, it was still the Republic of China, where storytelling, singing, juggling and fortune-telling were all commonplace.

;

;Yang Baozhang was in his teens and had no professional training. He formed a team with several other car repairmen and hairdressers who were fond of cross talk. In 1943, Tao Xiangjiu, a famous crosstalk artist from Beijing, came to perform in Kaifeng, and Yang Baozhang officially became his apprentice. After he opened the business in 1945, he stopped going to school. He got up early and memorized the passages "Geographic Map", "Reporting the Names of Dishes" and "Eight Screens" three times every day. Once the technology is over, the cultural foundation becomes thin again. There is a passage in "Eight Screens" written by Zhuge Liang to Cao Zhen. Yang Baozhang only knew how to recite it but did not understand the meaning. He did not know many words in "Geographical Map", and he had been reading "Quebei River" for many years. When talking about these in his later years, Yang Baozhang, who has become a master, does not hide it. He came from a grassroots background and has never left the folk.

;

;In the 1960s and 1970s, he could no longer talk about cross talk, so he went to the construction site and made cement. The foreman knew that he was good at jokes, and in turn advised him to save his energy during the day so that he could have the energy to talk long stories at night. . At that time, there was no stage decoration. There was a light in the barn, and there were cows and horses around. You could stand or sit in any position. If someone listened, you would open your mouth.

;

;After 10 years of doing this, my performance style has become more simple and natural. Although what he talks about is all literary, such as "Su Dongpo Eats Fish Three Times", "Confucius Eats Yuanxiao" and "The Legend of Liu Luoguo", they are either historical allusions or intellectual jokes, but Yang Baozhang can always speak in a homely and homely way without leaving any trace. After the 1980s, Yang Baozhang resumed performing. In 1993, he was invited by CCTV to record 20 episodes of the stand-up comedy "The Legend of Liu Luoguo".

;

;In recent years, many famous crosstalk masters have passed away, and Yang Baozhang has become almost the only living fossil in the crosstalk world. In 2010, Kaifeng City held a "Celebration of 86th Birthday Celebration for 68 Years in the Arts" event for Yang Baozhang. Yu Qian went to celebrate his birthday, and Yang Baozhang performed a piece of "Ghost Story". When Yu Qian returned, he sighed: "Master Yang has so many things in his belly." ."

;

;On his 90th birthday, Guo Degang also went to celebrate his birthday. During his speech, he joked: "I will definitely come to Mr. Yang's 90th birthday. Today I have promoted a commercial performance worth 80 million." "Two years later, courtesy reciprocated, Yang Baozhang went to attend the 20th anniversary celebration of Deyun Society. When he came on stage, he threw away the "baggage": "In order to participate in this event of Deyun Society, I recommended a 160 million yuan. Tang Hui, why? It’s the acupuncture point set by my senior brother Baolin, and I don’t dare to go there!” Hou Baolin is also a famous master of the Bao generation, and he left Hexi in 1993. Two things in one sentence made the audience burst into laughter.

;

;On November 12, 2023, Yang Baozhang still could not escape the "tang meeting" and passed away. According to actor Yi Cun's recollection, Yang Baozhang lost his hearing and speech in his later years and relied on others to take care of him for food and movement. Fortunately, his descendants did their best and Yang Baozhang died peacefully. His funeral was simple and simple, just like what he often said during his lifetime: "I am an artist. I only do one thing in my life, and I can tell cross talk."

;这近半个月来，过来咨询短剧出海业务的厂商，忽然多了起来。朱海聪意识到，短剧市场又到了一个新的节点。 “以前主要是头部的大公司在做（出海短剧），现在一些中小厂商也开始感兴趣。”他是深圳一家专门承制海外短剧公司的经理，短短半年多来的经历，让他不禁感慨，短剧市场真是风云变化。

;

;短剧出海已经形成风潮，而行业整治正在加剧这一趋势的发展。 “整顿是直接原因，主要是国内太卷了。”朱海聪向南方周末记者介绍，他们公司原本主要是承接国产品牌海外市场的宣传业务，在欧美有很多拍摄资源。大约在半年前，开始有企业找上门，想要拍摄网文改编的短剧，经过一番市场调研，其所在公司认定这的确是一个风口，便自然而然开拓业务。

;

;当地取景，当地现攒剧组，拍摄完毕，剧组原地解散。因为有多年资源积累，朱海聪所在公司很快解决了拍摄团队问题，核心问题还是东西方文化差异。 “本质上，短剧是一种文化输出，老外导演刚开始不是很能理解。”他回忆，公司承接的第一部短剧，讲述的是一个外卖小哥逆袭的故事：小哥发现女朋友和一名富二代有暧昧关系，并且受到对方羞辱，但是很快实现逆袭，打脸了这对“狗男女”。但这么简单的剧情，导演却不能把情绪饱满地传递出来。

;

;“不是因为这个导演没水平，恰恰可能是因为水平太高。”他解释，为了得到逆袭后的爽感，需要在男主角受辱的时候，给到眼神、表情很多特写，但是老外导演却运用了很多中景和远景，“运镜不到位，那种剧烈的冲突就表现不出来。”朱海聪不得不换了导演和摄影，才达到他满意的效果。

;

;不过，东西方观众在情感上依然有很强的相似性。 “会做一些本土化处理，但是内核是相通的。”朱海聪介绍，中国人一眼就能理解外卖小哥的设定，但在北美和欧洲，专职的外卖小哥并不算很多，相较而言，狼人、吸血鬼的故事外壳，老外们天然容易理解。 However, no matter what type of settings, the core of the story is general and revenge, and "foreigners are also very good."

;

;“很奇怪、很离谱，但是也很上头，想知道接下来故事怎么发展。”朱海聪说，目前来自中国的短剧，已经在西方文化消费市场占据一席之地。不过，取得成功的厂商皆为“网文出海”多年的头部大公司，因为在海外拍短剧的成本，比国内要高出很多。

;

;他介绍，在国内，二三十万元便可以拍摄一部100集的短剧，但是在北美市场，人力、物力和场租费用要比国内高出很多，一部短剧的成本折合成人民币，至少在100万元以上，而这个数字，是至少拍摄数量达到七八部以上之后，均摊之后的成本线，再加上运营、推广，至少具备千万元以上的项目体量，才可以考虑出海事宜。

;

;他留意到，观望和参与出海的短剧厂商，现在越来越多。 “这说明，国内的短剧厂商，其实发展得很快。”

;

;;

;

;横店一处短剧拍摄现场。南方周末记者赵明摄

;

;大资本已经入场

;

;夏夏（笔名）是从传统剧集转换到短剧赛道的编剧，经过几番内容调整，她敏锐觉察到，或许集中整治是行业向精品化过渡的一个契机。她向南方周末记者解释，传统剧集也会有逆袭情节，但是逆袭前后需要铺垫过程，剧情有主线、副线，人物有成长弧度，但是短剧不需要这些铺垫，短剧需要在最短时间内实现逆转，这个套路便是短剧的“精髓”。

;

;在短剧时代，观众的情绪需要得到“即时满足”。 “就是情绪PPT，上下PPT之间不太连贯，也都OK。”夏夏说，观众不希望看到主角受委屈、被侮辱，如果女主被打了耳光，女主老公必须立马两个耳光还回去，“没有啥逻辑，不停反转，不停打脸就可以了”。

;

;“你打我一巴掌，我扇你一耳光，没有人喜欢一直写这种剧本吧？”她说，行业规范后，那些特别浮夸、完全无脑、没有逻辑且脱离实际的剧集将受到限制，如果有大资本入局，吸引更优秀的人才入行，短剧的质量说不定也会水涨船高。

;

;事实上，短剧市场的蓬勃正吸引越来越多的人才涌入。据媒体报道，不断有TVB的老艺人、老演员加入到微短剧的拍摄；而头部互联网平台也纷纷下场，拍摄短剧抢占市场。 “好演员加入，肯定会提升品质。”华哥说，头部平台的加入会对短剧市场发展产生比较深远的影响。

;

;他介绍，当前短剧的主要盈利模式集中在付费观看阶段，而为了得到曝光，制作方要在平台上大规模“投流”，以获取流量，这一支出占很大成本。而大公司、大平台的加入，会带来新的分账模式以及IP孵化模式。甚至一些品牌方也在和短剧制作方直接接触，品牌植入式的短剧也在蓬勃兴起。

;

;与此同时，大资本方也越来越多地加入到这场盛宴。 “我们也在积极和私募机构接洽。”华哥说，公司会同时推进多部短剧的拍摄，手头刚刚杀青了4部，横店因为短剧市场的兴起，又是一幅欣欣向荣的场景。因为演员档期紧张，场地也有很多剧作排队，剧组经常要熬夜赶进度。所以，公司打算投资兴建两个拍摄棚，这种重资产需要大量资金投入。

;

;华哥和剧组常年驻扎在横店。他介绍，剧本、演员就位后，一个星期便可以完成一部短剧的拍摄，早些时候，十几万元的成本便可以制作一部剧集，后来大概需要二三十万元。现在，制作成本已高达一百万元，两百万元的剧集也在大量出现。

;

;November 30, 2023, published by "Shanghai Rule of Law News" The article states: The woman comes from a well-off family and serves as the director of a foreign-funded company; the man is the receptionist at the hotel where the woman’s company’s annual meeting is held. The man pursued the woman fiercely, and later they got married. After the marriage, the woman's parents died in a car accident while traveling. Half a year later, the man filed for divorce and requested a division of the woman's inheritance from her parents. The woman's parents own nine properties and shops in Shanghai, as well as more than 10 million yuan in bank deposits and financial products, with a total value of about 200 million yuan.

;

;This article once reached the top of the hot search, with a main tag having more than 600 million views, and popular comments including "I even suspected that the car accident..." You can spend 10 million to deal with it, and I guarantee that the man will not get a dime." He also accused the man of "taking advantage of the poor", and in short, scolded him for being shameless.

;

;This is actually a story told by lawyer Tan Fang. He neither gave a specific timeline nor presented credible evidence including judicial documents. Some netizens discovered that when she shared this story on Zhihu in 2022, she had the label "the content contains fictional creations".

;

;For this reason, some media interviewed Ma Lei, a partner at Tan Fang's law firm, who said that the case was real and only involved the client's privacy. , will fabricate sensitive information such as names. However, it is very common to use pseudonyms in news reports. Journalists only need to mark it in the text or at the end of the article. They will not consider themselves to be "fictional creations" by using pseudonyms.

;

;In summary, the authenticity of this case is doubtful and needs further confirmation. But the emotions and reactions triggered by this story are real and strong: as can be seen from the massive online comments, the public generally does not agree with and find it difficult to accept the legacy left by the man's parents and the girl's parents.

;

;Moreover, there are indeed such cases in judicial practice. In March this year, the Guangxi High Court issued a property dispute case. In 2021, Zhang and his wife Wang agreed to divorce, and their daughter lived with Wang. On the grounds that Zhang failed to pay child support, Wang filed a post-divorce property dispute lawsuit with the court. During the trial, Wang learned that Zhang’s mother died during the cooling-off period of their divorce and left behind a property. Zhang sold the above-mentioned house, and Wang requested to divide the sales proceeds obtained by Zhang from selling the house. In the end, the court ruled that Zhang should pay more than 2.18 million yuan in the sale price of the house inherited by Wang.

;

;During the relationship between husband and wife, it is legal for one party to request a division of the parental estate inherited by the other party. The marriage and family section of the current Civil Code stipulates that "property inherited or donated" is the common property of husband and wife and owned jointly by husband and wife (Article 1062). This is the default principle; only when "it is determined in the will or gift contract that only one party will own it" "Property" is the personal property of one spouse (Article 1063).

;

;Such provisions in statutory law are intended to expand the scope of joint property between husband and wife, allowing the economically weaker party to have more property to divide in the event of divorce.

;

;The problem is that when marriage becomes a tool for wealth redistribution, both marriage and wealth become unsafe.

;

;As far as marriage is concerned, under statutory laws and judicial practices that expand the scope of joint property between husband and wife, if two people with a huge gap in property and income get married, the marriage will become It’s even more unstable because it promotes the stereotype that “marriage is to start a business, divorce is to get rich”. Whether it is adding one's name to the property before marriage (= giving away half of the property), one of the parents did not make a will and left an inheritance, or one party in the marriage has too strong wealth creation ability or becomes rich overnight, these are only the joint property of the husband and wife during the marriage. One party may not have substantial control and dominance, but as long as there is a divorce, the other party can actually obtain control and dominance of half of the property. If a person obtains a large amount of wealth through divorce, achieves financial freedom, and feels so happy, this will inevitably inspire evil in human nature.

;

;In terms of wealth, a property in first-tier cities often costs tens of millions, and is often the accumulation of wealth for at least two generations. Just because a marriage certificate costs Losing half of a house is very unfair and makes people who hold real estate in big cities very insecure. Therefore, more and more people ask for a match before getting married, or just hold a wedding without getting a certificate, so as to avoid being "exploited" in the event of divorce.

;

;Back to the issue of inheritance, it is natural and reasonable for parents to hope that their property will be left to their children or other blood-related descendants a hundred years from now. Consistent with natural law and customary law.

;

;In the absence of a will and legal inheritance, in accordance with natural law and customary law, the inheritance left by parents to their children should of course be inherited by their children. personal property. However, as mentioned above, current statutory law and judicial practice stipulate that it is joint property of husband and wife by default. If one parent dies suddenly without leaving a will, the greed of the other parent may be aroused. Through divorce, they can divide half of the other parent's inheritance, achieve financial freedom, and reach the peak of life.

;

;Of course, many people believe in love, and also believe that being economically disadvantaged does not necessarily mean being morally despicable, but don’t test human nature, as long as a certain proportion of economically disadvantaged people can make progress Taking this step is enough to destroy the trust that should exist in marriage and make everyone fear marriage.

;

;Elderly people who are knowledgeable, educated and understand the law know what to do. Some media reports: Recently, 85-year-old Grandma Liu came to the China Wills Library to make a will and wanted to give her property to The granddaughter, son and daughter-in-law all know and agree. She said she lived a happy life in her later years and was not afraid of making a will. She was once the coach of a modeling team. The consideration is roughly like this: leaving it directly to the son is natural, but the daughter-in-law may be unhappy and complain "you don't trust me"; leaving the son directly to the granddaughter perfectly solves this problem.

;

;"China Will Library White Paper (2022)" shows that 99.8% of the elderly who make wills state that the inheritance will be inherited by the children alone and does not belong to the joint property of the heirs. It is the so-called "protection against daughter-in-law and son-in-law" clause.

;

;In the final analysis, it is all forced by the current statutory law and judicial practice. The elderly have worked hard all their lives to accumulate real estate, and most elderly people cannot accept it psychologically if "outsiders" who are not related by blood and may divorce and leave at any time take away half of the house. However, more elderly people do not have this awareness.

;Ma Guoguang (1928-2014) Zhejiang, Judge Zheng Ruyu (1930-2022) Zhejiang, Teacher;;

;

;The bulging key bag suddenly became lighter, and the sale of the parents' house was completed. They moved into this apartment in early 2009, and this house carries every bit of their old age.

;

;Before his retirement, my father was the vice-president of a district court in Shanghai. He was 1.78 meters tall, handsome in appearance, upright and principled, and full of romantic warmth. Even when he was in pain, he would hold his mother's hand. The hand said "the hand is too cold". My mother is the eldest daughter in the family. After graduating from nursing school, she took on the responsibility of raising her younger siblings. She has an easy-going personality and is less than 1.6 meters tall but seems to have endless energy. She was still tenacious before being sent to the ICU. Swallow food.

;

;Let us have food to eat and eat well, which is my mother’s lifelong obsession. Materials were scarce in the 1960s, but as long as she was at home, every meal in our family would be delicious, with both meat and vegetables. Even the presentation was unambiguous. When the dishes were put into the bowl, there would be soup splashing on the edge of the bowl. She Be sure to wipe it clean before serving it. Every New Year's Day, the house is filled with the aroma of meat and rice dumplings... My mother's cheeks, red from overwork, show a smile of contentment, enjoying a rare moment of rest.

;

;After we got married, every weekend when we went there, she would happily take out large and small boxes and bottles filled with vegetables and soups, with "food instructions" written on medicine box paper attached. She said, "If I have a fever one more time, you can eat one more time." In this way, she stubbornly persisted until she was hospitalized last year.

;

;At work, my mother is equally serious and hardworking. After a day of housework, she often uses her chair as a table to study by herself, prepare work materials, and write teaching materials. She graduated from a nursing school and later worked as a teacher, gradually becoming a leader in the nursing discipline in Shanghai. In the 1970s, my mother signed up to support the Huaibei Medical Team. In order to travel more points, she sometimes had to walk dozens of kilometers a day on mountain roads. At that time, she was over 40 years old, and she eventually fell ill with pneumonia from exhaustion. My mother worked until she was 70 years old and retired with the title of senior lecturer. She was famous all over the world. The "Nursing" textbook she participated in compiled laid the foundation for the development of today's nursing field.

;

;After retirement, my mother was not idle. She learned English, sang, knitted sweaters for relatives and friends, and wrote memoirs... She said, "I have to do something while I'm alive, so I can't live in vain."< /p>;

;When I was a child, every evening we would wait for my father’s tall figure to appear at the entrance of our house at the entrance of the alley. My father loved reading. In that spiritually barren era, we were delighted to get a book. After retirement, biographies of famous people became the books my father often read. He is erudite and has a strong memory, and often discusses current affairs with his colleagues and juniors.

;

;During the "Cultural Revolution", my father was sent to a ferroalloy factory to do manual labor. He had to carry dozens of kilograms of sledgehammers every day. This was a great test for him who grew up in a scholarly family. But he comes home happy every day. He sincerely mingled with the workers. At that time, our family often gathered workers and friends to talk and laugh.

;

;My father was sincere, upright and aboveboard throughout his life, never ambiguous about right or wrong. In his will, he also told us to "be upright and upright." He never judged people by money and status. Once, a part-time worker who had worked in our family for several years became seriously ill. He was very concerned and asked us to send money to help. This part-time worker would make a special trip to visit his father every time he returned to Shanghai for medical treatment.

;

;My father has always kept his home spotless. In the last three months, he could no longer walk, and he still looked in the mirror to neatly style his hair. In the early summer of 2013, feeling that his life was coming to an end, he made a will: "I am 86 years old, and I have no regrets..."

;

;My parents have gone through 53 years of ups and downs together, which is rare in my memory. They blushed, let alone argued. Our parents gave us a warm home with their lifelong efforts and love; they taught us how to face the impermanence of the world with a positive and optimistic attitude towards life.

;

;My parents were reunited in heaven. Our golden years as siblings are gone forever. We feel so deeply the loneliness of the soul and the sadness of being homeless.

;

;The love between parents is as deep as the ocean, and the son wants to support him but refuses to take care of him.
